s.text: People forget, or most never knew, that in its early years, fascism was a powerful intellectual movement.
People forget, or most never knew, that in its early years, fascism was a powerful intellectual movement.
The day of his death was a dark cold day.

In 1945, when I was managing editor of the monthly magazine Common Sense (my editor was Varian Fry, who had returned to New York after saving countless lives of artists and writers by arranging for their exit from Vichy France to Spain and Portugal and then to safer havens), I had asked Tucci to write a monthly column.
